justification: The protocol lists “EEG frontal asymmetry (indicator of approach vs. avoidance motivation)” as one of the real-time data collection measures.
Participants provide “concurrent self-reported emotional intensity using a 5-point scale slider,” indicating this scale is used to measure emotional intensity.

After each stimulus, participants are asked to “rate their subjective emotional alignment with the predefined telos … on a semi-circular scale, where 0° indicates perfect alignment and 180° indicates full opposition.”
In the trust calibration example, “fMRI indicates vmPFC activation (associated with social trust),” tying vmPFC activity measured via fMRI to the construct of social trust.
